Reviews.Content: Not cheap, but the AC Aitana is good Have stayed here a few times and I always choose it when I'm in Madrid but it's the second AC hotel I've reviewed on this site - and the 2nd in which the aircon didn't work and the room uncomfortably hot. I see a pattern emerging... If you stay here, try for a room away from the road, otherwise I think it's a great hotel in an excellent location near to the Bernab茅u stadium. Nice reception staff too - really friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: Babs2

Reviews.Content: Handy for Santiango Bernabeu Excellent location if you're planning on watching the football at the Bernabeu. Close to the Metro for visiting other parts of Madrid too.Nice, clean hotel - maybe trying a little too hard to be trendy! Very comfortable beds and excellent pillows. Good, well-stocked bathroom. I had a 6th floor room overlooking the busy Paseo de la Castellana but road noise was not a problem at all.Excellent breakfast. Don't be seduced by the 'free minibar' - its very limited (couple of beers, water and soft drinks) - better than nothing though.Good choice.
Reviews.Author: traveller131

Reviews.Author: waggers13

Reviews.Content: Good business hotel, but noisy rooms! Good business hotel, a little bit further out from Madrid centre than others.Stylish and relaxed, the hotel just manages to get the balance right between looking like modern, designer hotel rather than a cheap Ikea showroom. Dark cherry wood interiors, glass doors, modern sinks and I had an enormous bed.However, the rooms can be noisy, both from the road outside, and also from neighbours. It's never great to hear you neighbours morning ablutions!The basement restaurant is characterless, and filled with office chairs on wheels which is slightly bizarre. Food was fine, but there are too many good restaurants in Madrid to go to instead.Staff are helpful.All in all, a more interesting choice than some more traditional, tired hotels, but nothing to make a special trip for.
Reviews.Author: Seat1A

Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel, noisy room The AC Aitana is very stylish - wooden floor in the room, marble bathroom and glass shelf for the sink. The free minibar is a nice touch. The WiFi network worked perfectly for me (though a colleague had some difficulty with this). We got a great business rate of 鈧?00 per night (plus breakfast  taxes) which compares favourably to other hotels in that area. The only negative was the traffic noise, as I probably had the worst room in the house (2nd floor, facing main road). Ask for a room at an upper floor and/or away from the main road for a peaceful night.
Reviews.Author: IrishRainyDay

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, noisy room We were at this four stars hotel on March 2005 (2 nights).It lasts 3 minutes walking to get from the Hotel to the nearest underground station. Hotel staff was friendly and allways showed interest to attend our requests.Room was large, clean and with all you can need: TV, minibar (for free), 1,5 meter wide bed, office desk, two chairs and one armchair. Prices are similar to other 4 stars hotel in Madrid (under my point of view, all of them are expensive).Breakfast was excellent.The issue: the room was very noisy (placed at the Paseo Castellana). If you make a reservation, be carefull to ask for a room placed at secondary streets.

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Experience! We spent 4 nights in this ultra modern hotel with cherry wood floors and panels. Hotel is 5 minute walking distance from the Real Madrid Football stadium in the business district. However, there are 2 close metro stops that will quickly take you downtown. Desk staff was extremely helpful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fantastic, Contemporary Hotel!! This hotel is around 200 metres from Real Madrid's stadium and there aren't many other places to visit in this area. However, the excellent Metro system is not far away (and very cheap!), and takes around 15 mins to get to the historical centre of Madrid.The Hotel itself is very modern, and the rooms were an excellent size, with woodern floors and cherry veneer everywhere! The beds were a bit on the small size though.We were pleasantly suprised to find out that the minibar was free, as were the hot and cold drinks in the reception area downstairs.Be aware though that the hotel is very close to a major road (3 lanes each way), and road noise can be a bit of a problem.Overall though, this is well worth a visit!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
